programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les goes into detail about his plans for a new pawn store, and Ashley is caught in the crossfire when a fight breaks out in the middle of the floor.

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: While preparing to send another dive team to explore 10-X, Rick and Marty examine claims that Christopher Columbus can be linked to the Oak Island mystery.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: Deckhands step up to save the day when the hunters target some extra shrewd gators, and having fallen off the pace, one swamper goes in search of a new recruit.

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: Tough times in Alberta force Colin to assess his future and the Mission Towing crew races to clear a wreck that has shut down the rail line outside Hope, British Columbia.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick has a big decision to make when a programme from the unveiling of the Statue of Liberty shows up. He also hits the road to check out a 1966 Chevy II.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A signed AC/DC album and a Beals Model Remington revolver give the team pause for thought. Plus, Rick searches for new ways to publicise the pawn shop.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: At the new shop, the Golds are surprised to find a bag of gems inside a former employee's desk.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The Golds have a decision to make when a man wants to buy a pair of very expensive earrings on the condition that the store also does his piercing.

programme.title: Strippers: Cars for Cash
programme.desc: The teams focus on classic British motors as they strip the most valuable parts off a Rolls-Royce and a Jaguar Sovereign. Narrated by John Challis.

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: Further exploration of 10-X uncovers an item that could potentially link the island to Ancient Rome.

programme.title: Paranatural
programme.desc: Experts try to solve paranormal phenomena, looking at the Bermuda Triangle in the hope they can determine what has caused ships and planes to disappear.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Investigations into the possibility that insects have descended from, and could have links to, extraterrestrials which landed on Earth thousands of years ago.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A signed picture of the original Star Trek cast and an Eli Whitney Civil War revolver both pique the Pawn Stars' interest.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys examine a letter from Founding Father James Monroe and a promotional Playboy chair. Chum tries to reinvent himself in the image of Hugh Hefner.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Barry discovers a mysterious locker with a strange hole in its wall, while Jarrod uses an old trick to put in a sneaky bid.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod and Brandi learn that big cash comes in small packages, an indecisive Darrell finds himself in a bidder's quandary and Mark Balelo is back with all his usual bravado.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Former employee Tressa returns to sell the Rolex that got her sacked and Les struggles to control the situation when insults start to fly between her and Ashley.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les goes on the rampage when he finds out a thief has been on the premises, and a customer selling a guitar signed by Kid Rock reveals a valuable secret.

programme.title: Strippers: Cars for Cash
programme.desc: The teams focus on classic British motors as they strip the most valuable parts off a Rolls-Royce and a Jaguar Sovereign. Narrated by John Challis.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: Nasa footage of reported UFOs and alien presence, with comment from former Apollo astronaut Edgar Mitchell, and ex-Nasa contractor Donna Hare.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts investigate whether common human rituals may have been inspired by contact with aliens.

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: Further exploration of 10-X uncovers an item that could potentially link the island to Ancient Rome.

programme.title: Storage Wars Canada
programme.desc: Tensions among the buyers are at an all-time high, with the stress of competition on the auction circuit and the buyers facing major decisions with new business ventures.

programme.title: Storage Wars Canada
programme.desc: Roy hopes to strike it rich when he digs up a treasure trove of collectibles, while Cindy and Rick hope the power of voodoo will give them the upper hand.

programme.title: World's Deadliest Weather: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Wildfires ravage California, a tornado terrorises people trapped in a gas station, daredevils skydive over Antarctica, and a microburst causes chaos.

programme.title: Air Crash: Disasters Uncovered
programme.desc: Examining the San Bernardino train disaster, when a freight train derailed and crashed into a row of houses in a residential area - before causing the rupture of a gas pipe.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Dave comes to blows with his estranged brother over rock memorabilia, and Barry discovers a valuable piece of modern art.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: A mystery bidder begins to dominate the competition, pushing Dave to the limit.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: At the new shop, the Golds are surprised to find a bag of gems inside a former employee's desk.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The Golds have a decision to make when a man wants to buy a pair of very expensive earrings on the condition that the store also does his piercing.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You
programme.desc: Pointless co-host Alexander Armstrong takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz from May 2018, with comedian Sindhu Vee and Labour MP Jess Phillips joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Former BBC Breakfast presenter Bill Turnbull, Death in Paradise star Ben Miller and comedienne Jo Brand compete to have their pet hates banished on the light-hearted panel show chaired by Frank Skinner. Their gripes include middle-lane drivers, personalised number plates, low-slung jeans and homeopathy.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Rhod Gilbert, Jon Richardson and Kerry Godliman
programme.desc: Rhod Gilbert plays host for another dose of stand-up from the Hammersmith Apollo in London, warming up the audience before introducing routines by 8 Out of 10 Cats panellist Jon Richardson and actress and comedienne Kerry Godliman.

programme.title: Rhod Gilbert's Work Experience
programme.desc: The comedian's sense of humour is put to the test when he is sent to the Brecon Beacons to take part in one of the British Army's most gruelling training exercises.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletcher and the rest of Slade's inmates take advantage of the relaxed atmosphere - and of Barrowclough - with Mackay away on holiday. Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale star.

programme.title: True Evil: The Making of a Nazi
programme.desc: Albert Speer, the apolitical architect whose desire to build grand buildings led him to sell his soul.

programme.title: Inside Hitler's Killing Machine
programme.desc: Documentary about the Holocaust and some of the key figures involved, beginning with Hjalmar Schacht, who was never a Nazi but played a vital role in Hitler's plans.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Inside Hitler's Killing Machine
programme.desc: The story of the Ahnenerbe research institute, which was set up to provide scientific backing to Hitler's ideology, through a series of horrific experiments.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The stories behind an abandoned Second World War aviation facility in Farnborough, a Soviet airbase in the Gobi Desert, and a disused furnace in Pittsburgh.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: Nicholas Day investigates a horrifying discovery made in a Brighton left luggage office in 1934 - which was soon followed by a similar suspicious incident in London.

programme.title: True Evil: The Making of a Nazi
programme.desc: Albert Speer, the apolitical architect whose desire to build grand buildings led him to sell his soul.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the second of two programmes from Bowood House, Wiltshire, and hears the story of a man who went in search of his biological father after finding letters to his mother from an American soldier. The experts examine a box engraved with a secret code, a cigarette case made by a Russian craftsman, a collection of transistor radios and a cartoon based on a news story about an escaped lion that hid in a school.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Dave gets a nasty surprise when he opens the bonnet of a fast Ford from the 80's, and an Austin Heavy 12 nearly a century old sets off a bidding war at the auction.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from Woking in Surrey to Clapham Junction in south London. Along the way he gets close to some precious Victorian botany at Kew Gardens, tries his hand at croquet and discovers a very surprising 19th-century place of worship.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from Victoria station to Abbey Wood in south-east London. Along the way he learns how volunteer Victorian firefighters liked a tipple, discovers that 19th-century sewage pumps were a marvel of design and puts in a shift at the oldest fish market in Britain.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents an episode focused on Indian art and culture from the Neasden Temple in North London, revealing the connections between British and Indian history. Among the artefacts being valued are ceremonial robes used in the Delhi Durbar, a ring given to a boy by a princess, a Rolls Royce made for the Maharajah of Jodhpur and a bracelet found in a children's toy box that turns out to have a surprising background.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: Following the epic journey of a humpback whale and its calf as they travel from a tropical paradise to the species' great feeding ground in the icy polar seas. David Attenborough also observes footage of colonies of seabirds in the Arabian desert and surfing dolphins in Australia that swim onto the beach to catch their fish.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek, with help from the Mathewson clan, drag a mini pickup out of the barn where it's been for 20 years, and a 350cc Douglas Mark V motorbike from 1950 goes under the hammer.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The stories behind an abandoned Second World War aviation facility in Farnborough, a Soviet airbase in the Gobi Desert, and a disused furnace in Pittsburgh.

programme.title: Nazi Victory: The Post-War Plan
programme.desc: How Hitler used recreation to promote his ideology, setting up the world's largest beach resort and travel agency and attempting to turn the Olympics into a propaganda tool.

programme.title: True Evil: The Making of a Nazi
programme.desc: A profile of Adolf Eichmann, the talented bureaucratic civil servant whose robotic willingness to follow orders led him to design the system that would bring about the holocaust.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from London's King's Cross to Peterborough and discovers how a derelict part of the capital is being rejuvenated. He also puts in a shift at a Cambridgeshire brick factory and meets members of an immigrant community linked to it.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from Spalding to Grimsby, along the way learning about how Lincolnshire farmers utilised the railway to improve their harvests, visiting the impressive cathedral in Lincoln and looking to the future of rail freight.

programme.title: Secrets of the Solar System
programme.desc: Discovering the eerie wasteland of failed planets and strange rocks that lies beyond Mars and before Jupiter.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: The disappearance of an illicit tin of pineapple chunks leaves the inmates horrified that there is a thief in their midst - and for a while, no one is above suspicion. Prison comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Godber is feeling dejected after his romantic fortunes take a turn for the worse, so Fletch tries to revive his friend's flagging spirits. However, his cunning plan has one potential drawback - it involves his own daughter. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletcher and the rest of Slade's inmates take advantage of the relaxed atmosphere - and of Barrowclough - with Mackay away on holiday. Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale star.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Mathewsons agree to sell a vintage threshing machine and large collection of tractors, but extracting them from old barns on a Yorkshire farm proves a bigger job than anticipated.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A delightful collection of British classics comes up for auction, including an Austin A35 and a Hillman Avenger Estate in stunning condition. An E-Type Jaguar also hits the auction.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Emilia Fox joins the cast of the crime drama as Dr Nikki Alexander, who uses the team's equipment to solve an Iron Age mystery, but ends up bringing her expertise to bear on a modern murder. The case in question is the death of a jockey crushed by his mount during a race. The plot thickens when two of the horses' owners are killed in a helicopter crash and evidence emerges that both the horse and the pilot were drugged. James Wilby and Sylvestra Le Touzel guest star.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Sheelagh Murphy announces she's transferring to the Child Protection Unit at Croydon and Roger Valentine has temptation put in his way by bent copper Harry Haynes, the man he's investigating. As the coroner's hearing into the death of David Kent approaches, June Ackland nervously prepares to meet her long-lost son Gabriel, and a barrage of questions about his father forces her to reveal the circumstances under which she became pregnant.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: A short circuit causes havoc at a children's party, and Blue Watch have to save a man hanging over an electrical transformer. Starring Andrew Kazamia.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: An army policewoman who bears a grudge against Deborah threatens her life and the team are pushed to the limit on a rigorous training exercise.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Steve Evans meets a mystery woman and soon realises that she is more closely linked to the army than he would like. Mark finds himself breaking the law.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Sheelagh Murphy announces she's transferring to the Child Protection Unit at Croydon and Roger Valentine has temptation put in his way by bent copper Harry Haynes, the man he's investigating. As the coroner's hearing into the death of David Kent approaches, June Ackland nervously prepares to meet her long-lost son Gabriel, and a barrage of questions about his father forces her to reveal the circumstances under which she became pregnant.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Lola is concerned for baby Leanne's welfare, so she and Dan visit Steve's flat, but there is no answer, and all they can hear is an infant crying inside. Meanwhile, Abra is forced to reveal the reason for his his stockpile of medication after Kyla discovers his anti-viral drugs.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Patrick is mortified to discover he'll be shadowed by a medical student, but his spirits are lifted once they meet, and he soon becomes the envy of the ward. Meanwhile, Charlie receives bad news regarding his chances of regaining custody of Louis, and the paramedics find themselves in a difficult situation involving a potential suicide case. Drama, starring Derek Thompson and Ian Kelsey.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Zain Nadir has a chip on his shoulder about Mickey Webb's return to Sun Hill, refusing to work with Jack Meadows' blue-eyed boy, but he soon learns to appreciate his off-the-record policing skills. Honey and Amber are put under the microscope as appraisals loom and come through covered in glory, but Gina Gold upsets the entire team by introducing a 12-hour shift rota.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Grant realises how badly he has misjudged his old friend Dougie. Sharon and Michelle are left alone in the Vic after closing time and Sharon's worst fears about Doug are realised.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Both Michelle and Sharon are in an emotional state after the events of last night. Phil and Grant have some unfinished business to sort out.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: George and Pearce make a gruesome discovery in an empty flat, and Blue Watch attend a massive fire at a hospital. Starring Glen Murphy.

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Jack tries to help his ex-fiancee Karen, who is an acute schizophrenic, and fails to correctly diagnose Kim's rare infection. Medical drama, starring Amanda Burton and Kevin Whately.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: The locals are preoccupied with personal problems as Sally worries about her marriage, and Harding fears he is being undermined both at the factory and at home. Anna and David suspect Simon Goddard's activities in the town are not all they seem and a friendship is threatened by a former soldier's return. Rural drama, starring Thomas Craig, Samantha Giles and Brian Capron.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Sharon gets a shock when Social Security staff realise they are authorising rent payments for her old flat when she is no longer living there and her lodger is in prison.

programme.title: To the Manor Born
programme.desc: DeVere decides to shoot a commercial for his supermarket empire at Grantleigh and Audrey takes advantage of the cameras to tell the world what she thinks of him. Penelope Keith and Peter Bowles star.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Oh Shut Up and Eat Your Choc Ice
programme.desc: Japanese tourists spot Seymour and Clegg climbing into a bale of hay, and wonder whether it is a traditional Yorkshire custom. Michael Aldridge and Bill Owen star.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Who's That Bloke with Nora Batty Then?
programme.desc: Nora Batty is seen without her wrinkled stockings on, fuelling rumours that Compo might have a rival for her affections. When, she is later observed in the pub with another man, local tongues start wagging in earnest. Rural comedy, starring Bill Owen and Kathy Staff.

programme.title: Shakespeare & Hathaway - Private Investigators
programme.desc: Lu and Frank try to exonerate local criminal Billy the Brick when the local mayor is murdered in the dead of night. Comedy drama, starring Mark Benton and Jo Joyner.

programme.title: The Coroner
programme.desc: When Mick's rival landlord is found dead on the beach, Jane is forced to try to clear his name before he is charged with murder. Crime drama, starring Claire Goose.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Part one of two. Gerry is spooked by the discovery of UCOS's latest victim - a cop, whose body has lain untouched under a basement for 30 years. As accusations of police corruption and underhand dealings begin to surface, Gerry has to face up to some skeletons in his own closet and it's a race against time for the team to help before his murky past catches up with him. While babysitting his grandson, Gerry becomes convinced that only he holds the key to the investigation and goes Awol to uncover the truth. Starring Dennis Waterman and Denis Lawson.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The team is approached by a group of survivors from a recent train crash, who want the members to uncover the reasons for the disaster. In the process investigators stumble upon another mystery, when one of the bodies pulled from the wreckage remains unidentified. With Emilia Fox, William Gaminara, Tom Ward, Amita Dhiri and Emma Cunniffe.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: Daily magazine, featuring a mix of celebrity chat, showbusiness news, lifestyle features, topical discussion, health and beauty advice and more.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Guest panellists engage in topical debate and celebrity interviews from a female perspective.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Warwick Davis in which a team of London gym trainers answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then tries to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. Jason, Christine, Karen and Mark work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Best Walks with a View with Julia Bradbury
programme.sub-title: Britain's Best Walks with Julia Bradbury
programme.desc: The expert walker visits the Isle of Man, where her favourite island walk has it all - an ancient Manx river glen, the world's biggest mining waterwheel and a climb that culminates with spectacular views of England, Scotland and Ireland. With steam trains and electric trams on the TT island famous for Thomas the Tank Engine, her latest trek promises to be action-packed.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Carla is cornered by a mystery girl in the Rovers and Tim starts to wonder about Geoff's protestations of innocence after Sally tells him she wants Geoff out of the house. Ken fears that Daniel is neglecting himself and Toyah worries about Leanne after she tells her that Oliver has regressed.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Tracey is very welcoming when a surprise visitor turns up in the form of the attractive Emma, although Sharon is suspicious of the newcomer and Dorien is shocked to the core. Travis, on the other hand, is over the moon. Comedy, starring Pauline Quirke, Linda Robson, Lesley Joseph and Charlie Quirke.

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective is called in when David Kenworthy, the son of a prominent local family, is found murdered on the beach at Whitley Bay. A witness spotted arcade owner Larry Crowe arguing with David on the night of the killing, and a search of the suspect's property uncovers a bloodied baseball bat. However, Larry has a cast-iron alibi and it's clear he wasn't the only person the victim met that night. A second death then leaves Vera facing mounting pressure to crack the case, and struggling to answer the question of why David was drawn to the seafront on the evening of his father's retirement. Brenda Blethyn stars in the murder mystery, with David Leon as her trusty sidekick Joe.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Piers Morgan's Life Stories
programme.sub-title: Piers Morgan's Life Stories: Martin Kemp
programme.desc: The actor and musician joins the host to look back over his life and career. Martin, who found fame as the bassist in Spandau Ballet, before going on to star in EastEnders and The Krays, tells of the brain tumours that nearly killed him and reveals that George Michael helped him find a wife, as well as land his TV soap role. He also opens up about the deaths of his parents within days of each other, and how this prompted his band to get back together.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer goes in search of a Lotus Elan for sale, before handing the keys of the British sports car to Edd China so he can give the vehicle a new lease of life.

programme.title: American Pickers: Best Of
programme.desc: Some of Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz's finest finds and most premium picks in this series showcasing the best of their adventures.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: Part one of two. The gang teams up with Nascar's Kyle Petty to construct a bike for auction to benefit the Victory Junction Gang Camp, which caters for children with special needs.

programme.title: Flying Wild Alaska
programme.desc: Yuri is training in Bethel for a potential promotion when heavy ice forms on the wings of his aircraft. Meanwhile, Jim welcomes a greenhorn to the team.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe visits a dairy farm in Ramona, CA where he learns how to milk and breed dromedary camels.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The processes involved in making coloured crayons, model boats, putters and amphibious vehicles, and how these methods have evolved with changes in technology.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The processes involved in making marbles, aeroplane propellers, electric guitar amplifiers and American footballs.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How ugly root vegetables are transformed into sweet sugar. Plus, the manufacture of feather dusters and party balloons.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Henry and Sam return to the East Anglia to meet Charlie in Lowestoft. Finding everything from cars and bikes to stationary engines and suitcases, they really do have a positive dilemma on their hands.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Henry and Sam head down to a large old house in the depths of Devon's countryside. There are piles of cars wherever they look, and bikes seem to appear out of every nook and cranny. They are spoilt for choice, but what will they bid on?.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Two-hour episode. The Alaskan crab-fishing fleet returns to the Bering Sea to battle the most brutal winter in living memory and a sharp downturn in business.

programme.title: Scrap Kings
programme.desc: In Blackburn, the demo crew calls time on a brewing icon. Meanwhile, in the West Midlands an artist picks up the pieces to bring new life to an old motor.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer heads to Poland where he tries to bag a Lamborghini Urraco. However, the prices being asked might be in breach of his budget.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini tracks down a Ferrari 275 GTB4 in Boston and takes a spin in an original 275 in California.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini explores coachbuilder Steve Moal's collection of one-off cars and bids on a classic DKW at auction. He also asks Laurence Anderson for help when he has problems with his Bentley.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Vicki Butler-Henderson and Jason Plato take a day trip to France in the Ferrari 812 Superfast and Aston Martin DBS Superleggera. Plus, Jonny smith visits the Frankfurt Motor Show.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: The Bushmen risk their lives in the fight to get their one-tonne digger down a 20-metre deep mine shaft. Plus, new alliances are forged as the Boulder Boys hit pay dirt.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: It's October in Dutch Harbour Alaska, and after a devastating 2011 season, every ship in the fleet is looking to make a comeback in the 2012 season.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: In Michigan, Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz find a 1985 Cadillac, but what they really want is a pump. Then, they're shown a barn-fresh 1931 Ford Model A tow truck that is so rare it could be worth a small fortune.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard and Tee John take a road trip in Hungary. In Budapest, they visit one of the country's biggest antique markets. Later, they unearth treasures in a former communist factory.

programme.title: Scrap Kings
programme.desc: In Cheshire, a well-known hotel is pulled to the ground. Meanwhile, in Devon a father and son demolish a caravan and in Liverpool an iconic landmark is made from scrap.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer goes in search of a Lotus Elan for sale, before handing the keys of the British sports car to Edd China so he can give the vehicle a new lease of life.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: The Bushmen dodge rockfalls in a potentially deadly new mine. The Fire Crew closes in on a new deposit of precious black opal, while the Boulder Boys struggle to drain their opal pit.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard finds a mysterious piece of black pottery in Lancashire, locates an exotic piece in a zoo in East Anglia and fiercely haggles with an old foe in a salvage yard.

programme.title: Nasa's Unexplained Files
programme.desc: Experts investigate whether the Roswell UFO incident was a Soviet conspiracy masterminded by Stalin, or if the story may be another cover-up.

programme.title: Mummies Unwrapped
programme.desc: Archaeologist Ramy Romany investigates a mysterious underwater grave in the ancient Mayan city of Mayapan, where the buried may have been victims of human sacrifice.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The production of Chinamax, and a brand of Russian vodka.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The complex technological processes involved in creating St Petersburg Metro, Civet coffee and chip-makers.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer searches for the Bond Bug, a three-wheeled 1970s British sports car, hoping that if he can acquire one his expert mechanic Edd China can make it roadworthy once more.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Evidence found underwater, including the case of a woman discovered floating in a pond and a man who claimed his girlfriend was killed by a flash flood.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: After 37-year-old Natasha Cournoyer went missing, police used surveillance video to track her final steps. Eventually, they found her bound, raped, beaten and strangled to death in October 2009.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of Missouri farmers Charles and Grace Lewis, who were killed in September 1993. William Rousan was later found to have masterminded their murder as part of a plot to steal their cattle, assisted by his teenage son Brent, and his brother Robert.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: How investigators came to suspect that the perpetrator of a sophisticated string of Chicago bank robberies could be a policeman.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: The agents are sent to rescue a three-legged Labrador and bring the animal back to the sanctuary in a bid to teach it how to overcome its limitations.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown is called to Cairns Rainforest Station Nature Park to check on the broken jaw of Agro the crocodile, who has managed to kill all nine of the other crocs in his pond.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: Lori tries to find a gown for a group of bridesmaids who hate the wedding's colour scheme, while Leslie faces a mutiny when she struggles to pick a dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.sub-title: Two Mums Are Better Than None
programme.desc: The competition gets fierce when Hannah brings both her mum and stepmother to help her choose a dress, while Kourtney suffers due to her mother's absence.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: JoLee's mother would be happy to see her daughter walk down the aisle in any white piece of clothing - so long as it hides her figure.

programme.title: French Collection
programme.desc: Sandra, Duncan and Sarah are given 800 euros to spend at an antiques market in the small town of Sommieres near Montpellier, under the watchful eye of expert dealer Mark Franks.

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: At Pickwick Pawnbrokers in London, Nathan and his sidekick Debbs seal the deals on an unusual life-size Majolica lion, a rare book and racing silks owned by jockey AP McCoy. Meanwhile, at Dan's London Road Shop in Sheffield, the team values a selection of high-end rubies and an unusual astronaut jukebox.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: The team pulls out all the stops to save a newborn foal when it is found with its abandoned mother.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Animal cruelty investigator Barbara Christiansen rescues a horse found lying in a pool of water after heavy rain.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How technology such as mobile phones, CCTV and cashpoints can help solve murder investigations.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: The disturbing methods of female killers, who often take a less violent approach to murder than their male counterparts but can prove just as ruthless.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: Documentary investigating the case of Toni Lee Sharpless a nurse and mother with a bipolar disorder who vanished in August 2009 after a night out in Gladwyne, Pennsylvania. The car she was travelling in has never been recovered, though it was possibly spotted two weeks later in Camden, New Jersey.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 28-year-old Jeremy Alex, who was last seen in April 2004 running towards a house in Northport, Maine claiming that the 'bad guys' were after him.

programme.title: Dateline with Tamzin Outhwaite
programme.desc: Almost two years after his wife's murder, Dr Joe Sonnier was found shot and stabbed to death in his home. As the actress reveals, it would take a love triangle and an unlikely friendship to find his killer.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A bride tries on over 100 dresses in the search for the perfect look, while a woman getting married on a beach needs a gown that will cover her bare feet.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Caitie and her wedding planner father clash over a gown, while Danielle lost her mother to cancer, so her dad steps in to help her make the big decision.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Two brides are torn between a sexy look or a traditional one - and a disapproving father knows which he would prefer to see his daughter wearing.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A bride is more concerned with pleasing her mother than herself, while another customer has no idea what style of dress she wants.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A bride cannot choose between two dresses she thinks are perfect - while another customer has tried on 50 gowns and thinks none of them are right.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Former model Meghan comes all the way from St Louis to find the perfect dress for her wedding to a baseball player.

programme.title: Long Lost Family US
programme.sub-title: One More Reason to Fight for My Life
programme.desc: The case of Tammy, who is searching for her two younger brothers who vanished from her life when they were separated as children. Hosted by Chris Jacobs and Lisa Joyner.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Weighing over 700lbs at 26-years-old, the clock is ticking on Ashley's life. Ashamed of her body, surgery offers hope - but not without risks.

programme.title: Who Killed Jeffrey Epstein: An ID Murder Mystery
programme.desc: Exclusive interviews and an in-depth investigation reveal new clues about Jeffrey Epstein's seedy underworld, privileged life and controversial death.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Detectives suspect arson upon investigating the raging fire that turned a couple's home into a death chamber. Plus, officers employ the services of a special type of sniffer dog to track down a missing target.
